# Documentation Templates

This directory contains templates and standards for MCP Context Browser documentation.

## üìã Available Templates

### ADR Template

\1-  **[ADR-template.md](adr-template.md)**- Architecture Decision Record template
\1-  **Usage**: `make adr-new` to create new ADR interactively

### Document Standards

#### File Naming Convention

\1-   Use kebab-case for file names: `my-document.md`
\1-   Prefix with numbers for ordering: `01-getting-started.md`
\1-   Use descriptive names: `deployment-guide.md` not `deploy.md`

#### Header Structure

```markdown

# Document Title

[![Badge](https://img.shields.io/badge/status)](link)

**Brief description of document purpose**

## Table of Contents
\1-   Auto-generated by documentation system

## Section 1
Content...

## Section 2
Content...
```

#### Code Examples

```rust
// Use syntax highlighting for code blocks
pub fn example_function() -> Result<()> {
    // Implementation
    Ok(())
}
```

#### Cross-References

```markdown
<!-- Use relative paths for internal links -->
See [Architecture Overview](../architecture/ARCHITECTURE.md) for details.

<!-- Use absolute paths from docs root -->
See [Contributing Guide](developer/CONTRIBUTING.md) for guidelines.
```

## üõ†Ô∏è Template Usage

### Creating New Documents

1. **Choose appropriate category**:

\1-   `user-guide/` - User-facing documentation
\1-   `developer/` - Development guides
\1-   `architecture/` - Technical architecture
\1-   `operations/` - Deployment & operations

1. **Copy appropriate template**:

   ```bash
   cp docs/templates/adr-template.md docs/adr/new-adr.md
   ```

1. **Follow naming conventions**

2. **Validate before committing**:

   ```bash
   make validate-docs
   ```

## üìä Quality Standards

### Content Quality

\1-   [ ] Clear purpose and scope
\1-   [ ] Appropriate audience identification
\1-   [ ] Logical structure and flow
\1-   [ ] Accurate technical information
\1-   [ ] Up-to-date examples and code

### Format Quality

\1-   [ ] Consistent header structure
\1-   [ ] Proper markdown formatting
\1-   [ ] Syntax-highlighted code blocks
\1-   [ ] Working cross-references
\1-   [ ] Valid front matter (if applicable)

### Maintenance Quality

\1-   [ ] Automated updates where possible
\1-   [ ] Version control friendly
\1-   [ ] CI/CD validated
\1-   [ ] Regular review schedule

## üîß Automation

Templates are integrated with the build system:

```bash

# Create new ADR
make adr-new

# Validate all documentation
make validate-docs

# Check documentation consistency
make docs-consistency

# Generate documentation site
make docs-site
```
